title: Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie Recipe
description: This oatmeal smoothie has a deep pink color and a rich, creamy texture. It's fast, filling, and delicious — perfect for a quick on-the-go breakfast!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Breakfast and Brunch Drinks Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie 4.4 (1,239) 954 Reviews 87 Photos This vegan oatmeal smoothie has a deep pink color and a rich, creamy texture. It's very filling, and perfect for people in a rush in the morning. You don't have to give up a good breakfast when it's this fast to make! I use vitamin fortified soy milk. Submitted by ASTROPHE Updated on March 6, 2023 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 87 87 87 87 Prep Time: 5 mins Total Time: 5 mins Servings: 2 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 2 servings 1 cup soy milk ½ cup rolled oats 14 frozen strawberries 1 banana, broken into chunks 1 ½ teaspoons white sugar (Optional) ½ teaspoon vanilla extract (Optional) Directions Gather ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Blend soy milk, oats, strawberries, and banana in a blender until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla and blend again until smooth. Pour into glasses and serve. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  I Made It Print 2,244 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 142 Calories 4g Fat 21g Carbs 7g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 2 Calories 142 % Daily Value * Total Fat 4g 4% Saturated Fat 1g 3% Sodium 63mg 3% Total Carbohydrate 21g 8% Dietary Fiber 3g 10% Protein 7g 13% Calcium 41mg 3% Iron 2mg 9% Potassium 217mg 5% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie 01 of 87 Photo by  DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS  02 of 87 Photo by  Addilyn 05/18/2021 03 of 87 Photo by  geekygurl92 Sneed 01/27/2021 04 of 87 Photo by  Daphney Carter 10/10/2020 05 of 87 Photo by  Bri Moran 06/16/2020 This is very good!!! I made 3 of them. My fiance & 10 year old daughter love it, my 4 year old son said it was really good but he didn't want his own this morning, he just wanted some pieces of the bananas & strawberries but he did say next time he will have the smoothie!! I am definitely going to make it again! I did use vanilla soymilk instead of original & I had to add a little more to thin it out a little bit because the oats made it very thick. I also cut up a little bit of banana & strawberries & placed them on top of some whip cream!!! Next time I plan on using some Chobani Vanilla Oatmilk because that is one of my favorites & I think it will be very good to!!! I definitely recommend this to whoever hasn't tried it because it really is amazing! 06 of 87 Photo by  Bri Moran 06/16/2020 This is very good!!! I made 3 of them. My fiance & 10 year old daughter love it, my 4 year old son said it was really good but he didn't want his own this morning, he just wanted some pieces of the bananas & strawberries but he did say next time he will have the smoothie!! I am definitely going to make it again! I did use vanilla soymilk instead of original & I had to add a little more to thin it out a little bit because the oats made it very thick. I also cut up a little bit of banana & strawberries & placed them on top of some whip cream!!! Next time I plan on using some Chobani Vanilla Oatmilk because that is one of my favorites & I think it will be very good to!!! I definitely recommend this to whoever hasn't tried it because it really is amazing! 07 of 87 Photo by  Kristina Hall 05/28/2020 08 of 87 Photo by  lilydogs13 05/05/2020 very good! i used regular milk instead of soy milk and it was delicious! 09 of 87 Photo by  Lily 05/05/2020 very good! i used regular milk instead of soy milk and it was delicious! 10 of 87 Photo by  betty 02/19/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Fruity Non-Dairy Oatmeal Smoothie 1 Rating Flax Seed Smoothie 15 Ratings Quick Strawberry Oatmeal Breakfast Smoothie 17 Ratings Strawberry and Blueberry Oatmeal Health Shake 7 Ratings Strawberry Banana Breeze Smoothie 13 Ratings Very Berry Anti-Inflammatory Smoothie Strawberry-Avocado-Mint Smoothie 2 Ratings Strawberry-Lime-Cilantro Smoothie 1 Rating Strawberry Blueberry Smoothie 25 Ratings Chocolate, Strawberry, and Oatmeal Smoothie 1 Rating All-Fruit Smoothies 69 Ratings Rainbow Smoothie Packs 4 Ratings Blueberry Banana Oatmeal Smoothie 28 Ratings Tofu Fruit Julius 1 Rating Matcha-Berry Swirl Smoothie 1 Rating Chocolate-Covered Strawberries Smoothie 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. instructions: Gather ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios;Blend soy milk, oats, strawberries, and banana in a blender until smooth. Add sugar and vanilla and blend again until smooth. ;Pour into glasses and serve. DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS
